SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Veridian Plains relative to Crimson Peaks?
SRP.A: Veridian Plains is {below} Crimson Peaks in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total construction starts?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Veridian Plains}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total construction starts?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Crimson Peaks}.

VE.Q: What are the construction starts of Shadowfen, Golden Delta, and Crimson Peaks in 2008?
VE.A: Shadowfen's construction starts is {203.51} units/year, Golden Delta's construction starts is {514.86} units/year, Crimson Peaks's construction starts is {173.36} units/year.

SC.Q: What is the average total Construction Starts?

NC.Q: Between 2004 and 2019, did the total Construction Starts experience a larger or smaller change than between 2001 and 2008?
NC.A: The change in total construction starts between 2004 and 2019 was {larger} than between 2001 and 2008.

NC.Q: Was the total Construction Starts in 2002 higher or lower than in 2016?
NC.A: The total construction starts in 2002 was {higher} than in 2016.

NC.Q: Between 2015 and 2018, did the total Construction Starts experience a larger or smaller change than between 2005 and 2016?
NC.A: The change in total construction starts between 2015 and 2018 was {smaller} than between 2005 and 2016.

NC.Q: Was the total Construction Starts in 2016 higher or lower than in 2021?
NC.A: The total construction starts in 2016 was {lower} than in 2021.

MSR.A: {Veridian Plains} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Crimson Peaks, Shadowfen, Golden Delta, Veridian Plains}.
